description: The databaseUsers resource lets you retrieve, create and modify the MongoDB users in your cluster. Each user has a set of roles that provide access to the project’s databases. A user’s roles apply to all the clusters in the project: if two clusters have a products database and a user has a role granting read access on the products database, the user has that access on both clusters.

DatabaseName.description: The user’s authentication database. A user must provide both a username and authentication database to log into MongoDB. In Atlas deployments of MongoDB, the authentication database is always the admin database.

Labels.description: Array containing key-value pairs that tag and categorize the database user.

LdapAuthType.description: Method by which the provided username is authenticated. If no value is given, Atlas uses the default value of NONE.

ProjectId.description: Unique identifier of the Atlas project to which the user belongs.

Roles.description: Array of this user’s roles and the databases / collections on which the roles apply. A role allows the user to perform particular actions on the specified database. A role on the admin database can include privileges that apply to the other databases as well.

Scopes.description: Array of clusters and Atlas Data Lakes that this user has access to. If omitted, Atlas grants the user access to all the clusters and Atlas Data Lakes in the project by default.

Password.description: The user’s password. This field is not included in the entity returned from the server.

UserCNFIdentifier.description: A unique identifier comprised of the Atlas Project ID and Username

AWSIAMType.description: If this value is set, the new database user authenticates with AWS IAM credentials.
